Description: Large, square tapestry (single warp threads) panel in purple wool and undyed linen; Purple wool is a mix of dark blue and dark red fibres; Surrounding weft-faced, plain weave areas in undyed wool; Outline design in panel of a central roundel and a circular frame inside a square frame with spandrels, all filled with abstract patterning, beaded border (details in blue wool), outer plain frame; Warp: S spun wool, c.9tpc; Weft: S spun wool & linen, c.55tpc in plain and tapestry areas, soumak outlining in S spun Z ply wool & linen; Edges: outer edges all cut, pairs of internal selvedges at both sides; Sewing: joins to pairs of selvedges, herringbone stitch in S spun Z ply cream wool thread, slits at side partly repaired in red wool S spun Z ply thread, darning in thick dark brown S spun Z ply wool
Curator's comments: Unreg 83; Similar to EA72460; Previously in cupboard P and grey plan chest in Students' Room; Edges cut post excavation; Woven as part of a larger, mainly cream wool textile, probably a tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (15.5.1991)
Condition: Poor; Worn and discoloured, linen partly perished
